title: There was an interactive kerning tutorial ...
content:
online.

anyone remember the link?

:)

Cheers,

Paul Ducco
author: Ratbaggy

comments.content: Hey Paul. I think there was something on this at counterspace, but the page has either moved or disappeared. The link to it from [www.typebase.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231211758/http:/www.typebase.com/ "www.typebase.com") no longer seems to work, but there are other gems within their education section. There is also a topic page for kerning at Ellen Lupton's [www.thinkingwithtype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231211758/http:/www.thinkingwithtype.com/ "www.thinkingwithtype.com"). Not interactive, but informative. The essential thing is that negative space between characters should appear optically even, rather than mathematically equal.

yep, yep.

thanks Beno.

----------  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design, Melbourne](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231211758/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)
I was pretty sure it was a school/education site, I maybe wrong.

There's an interactive Letterspacing tutorial at the University of Delaware website:

[http://typography.art.udel.edu/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231211758/http:/typography.art.udel.edu/index.html "http://typography.art.udel.edu/index.html")

Hope that's the one you're looking for.

Does anyone know if this tutorial is still publicly available at a new address?

Thanks.

<cite>Does anyone know if this tutorial is still publicly available at a new address?</cite>

Question seconded. If it is the same as the one that I remember it was very good.
